meanings.definition: To change or alter something in order to improve it.
meanings.sent1: She is reformulating the recipe to make it healthier.
meanings.sent2: The company is reformulating its products to be more eco-friendly.
meanings.sent3: He kept reformulating the plan until it was perfect.
meanings.sent4: The artist was reformulating his painting with new colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: By reformulating the strategy, they were able to achieve better results.

meanings.definition: To express something in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is reformulating the explanation for the students to understand.
meanings.sent2: She is reformulating her thoughts into a clearer argument.
meanings.sent3: He enjoys reformulating jokes to make them funnier.
meanings.sent4: The poet was reformulating her emotions into beautiful verses.
meanings.sent5: By reformulating the question, he was able to get a different perspective.
